title: [出清國記] 澳洲廣播公司：澳中5日外交僵局 最後兩名記者走得甩

replies.msg:
睇新聞學英文，星期一至五早晚簡單翻譯啲外國報導，等大家可以雙語吸收資訊，學多啲英文尤其係咁多位DSE仔女一於齊上齊學
希望睇完幫手Like+推，鍾意就Dog/follow埋我
--------------------------------------------------


https://www.abc.net.au/news/2020-09-08/australian-reporters-evacuated-china-amid-threats-against-safety/12638786

Last two Australian correspondents pulled out of China after five-day diplomatic standoff over national security case


// The ABC and the Australian Financial Review have rushed their correspondents out of China after police demanded interviews with both journalists, resulting in an extraordinary diplomatic standoff. //
「喺公安要求同佢地兩個記者問話之後，ABC同Australian Financial Review拿拿聲帶走佢地嘅駐華記者，造成離奇嘅外交僵局。」

Standoff 本身講西部牛仔對決，拔槍前嘅僵局，再引申解僵持，同義詞有deadlock, stalemate, impasse。


// Bill Birtles, the ABC's correspondent based in Beijing, and Mike Smith, the AFR's correspondent based in Shanghai, boarded a flight to Sydney last night after the pair were questioned separately by China's Ministry of State security. //
「ABC駐北京記者Bill Birtles，AFR駐上海記者Mike Smith，兩人被國安部分別盤問後，昨晚登上翻悉尼嘅航班。」


// Birtles had spent four days sheltering in Australia's Embassy in Beijing, while Smith took refuge in Australia's Shanghai consulate as diplomats negotiated with Chinese officials to allow them to safely leave the country. //
「Birtles喺澳洲駐北京大使館避咗4日，同時Smith喺澳洲駐上海領事館避難，外交人員同中國官員談判，要求俾佢地安全離開中國。」


// The saga began early last week, when Australian diplomats in Beijing cautioned Birtles that he should leave China, with officials from the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade giving the same advice to ABC's managing director David Anderson in Sydney. //
「呢場傳奇長篇故事由上星期開始，當澳洲駐京外交人員提醒Birtles要離開中國，同時間澳洲外交貿易部嘅官員向喺悉尼嘅ABC Managing Director David Anderson俾同樣提議。」


//But the threatening behaviour from Chinese officials peaked before he could leave, when seven police officers arrived at Birtles' apartment at midnight last Wednesday as he was holding farewell drinks with friends and colleagues. //
「但喺佢走得甩前，中國官員嘅威脅行為達至高峰，上星期三7個公安去到Birtles屋企，當時Birtles仲揸住佢杯酒，同朋友同埋同事搞緊歡送會。」


// They told him he was banned from leaving the country, and that he would be contacted the next day to organise a time to be questioned over a "national security case". //
「公安話佢已經被禁止出境，第二日會有人通知佢去安排有關「國安案件」嘅問話。」


//Birtles called the Australian Embassy and arranged to be collected from his apartment. He stayed in the Beijing diplomatic compound for the next few days, where he was contacted by Chinese officials demanding an interview. //
「Birtles通知澳洲大使館，安排喺屋企接走佢。佢留喺北京嘅外交使館區幾日，然後被中國官員通知要求問話。」


// He initially refused to speak with them, citing fears for his personal safety. //
「一開始佢拒絕同呢班人講野，話對自己人身安全有擔憂。」

//Birtles was interviewed by Chinese authorities on Sunday, accompanied by Australia's ambassador to China Graham Fletcher, after an agreement was reached between Australian and Chinese officials that his travel ban would be lifted if he spoke to them.//
「星期日，澳中官員講掂數話如果Birtles肯同佢地講野就撤銷禁令。Birtles由澳洲駐華大使傅關漢(Graham Fletcher)陪同，被中國官員盤問。」


// During the meeting, no questions were asked about his reporting or conduct in China. //
「會面期間，冇一條問題係關於Birtles喺中國嘅報導同操守。」


// Birtles was told by embassy officials after the interview that his travel ban had been rescinded. He was joined by consular staff on a flight from Beijing to Shanghai early on Monday, where he waited for his flight to Sydney. //
「Birtles被使館人員告知，佢嘅旅行禁令已經喺會面後撤銷咗。領事人員喺星期一較早前由北京去上海嘅航班同佢合流，等佢飛翻悉尼嘅航機。」


//The unprecedented standoff marks another deterioration in the Australia-China relationship, already buffeted by tensions over trade, espionage, Hong Kong and the coronavirus pandemic. //
「呢場前所未見嘅僵局標誌住，此前已經被貿易、間諜、香港問題同武漢肺炎帶來既緊張關係打擊嘅澳中關係再度惡化。」

Buffet 名詞就係我地依家想食又唔敢食嘅自助餐「舖飛」，動詞解被風雨係咁打擊，引申出不斷被打擊既意思，同義詞有 batter, pound, lash, bang, strike (衝擊)

// The evacuation means for the first time since the mid-1970s there are no accredited Australian media journalists in China, with correspondent for The Australian Will Glasgow also out of the country. //
「今場撤離意味著由1970年代中期以來，計埋The Australian 記者Will Glasgow一早走埋，中國首次冇任何被授權嘅澳洲媒體記者。」

中美係1970年代建交，開始多左西方記者訪華，所以冇澳洲駐華記者係幾外交歷史上標誌性既事件。

希望睇完幫手Like+推，鍾意就Dog/follow埋我

replies.msg:
[全民檢測] 華爾街日報：社區封鎖根本唔撚關事
- 分享自 LIHKG 討論區
https://lih.kg/aCummGV

有巴打譯法好過我但我都照講下
//In theory, the spread of an infectious disease ought to be controllable by quarantine. Evidently not in practice, though we are aware of no researcher who understands why not.//

意思上，In practice 同 in theory相對應，evidently係evidence既副詞。如果我地將Evidently, not 同 in practice拆開，再放入上一句再改少少:
In practice, the spread of an infectious disease is evidently not controllable by quarantine.
係咪明左好多呢

DSE來講識理解已經好好，但唔識用既話就唔好係writing 用

[全民檢測] 華爾街日報：社區封鎖根本唔撚關事
- 分享自 LIHKG 討論區
https://lih.kg/aCummGV

有巴打譯法好過我但我都照講下
//In theory, the spread of an infectious disease ought to be controllable by quarantine. Evidently not in practice, though we are aware of no researcher who understands why not.//

意思上，In practice 同 in theory相對應，evidently係evidence既副詞。如果我地將Evidently, not 同 in practice拆開，再放入上一句再改少少:
In practice, the spread of an infectious disease is evidently not controllable by quarantine.
係咪明左好多呢

DSE來講識理解已經好好，但唔識用既話就唔好係writing 用

replies.msg:
其實係, 但係如果個腦本身冇個概念:
"我諗緊一樣野 => 有咩字可以形容呢樣野 => 呢堆字應該用咩方法排列, 令其他人睇/聽得明 (文法) =>我講出黎睇對方有咩回應 => loop"
直接用英文學英文係比較難, 特別係字本身就脫離唔到當地文化, 唯有邊學邊改進, 睇多啲feel下點解啲句子咁寫, 點解有咁嘅expression
(到2020年都仲係有人覺得grammar唔重要 "啲鬼佬唔注重架" )
樓豬好有心
